title: Eating for Two: Asian Cabbage Salad
summary: Eating for Two: Asian Cabbage Salad might be just the salad you are searching for. One serving contains 261 calories, 12g of protein, and 14g of fat. For $1.66 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. It is perfect for valentin day. This recipe from Serious Eats has 1 fans. Head to the store and pick up carrots, another ground chile paste, seasoned rice vinegar, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and vegan diet. With a spoonacular score of 84%, this dish is super. Try Clean Eating Roasted Cabbage Wedge & Apple Salad, Asian Cabbage Salad, and Asian Cabbage Salad for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are great choices for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Domaine Weinbach Cuvee Theo Gewurztraminer with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 29 dollars per bottle.

instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Cook the edamame according to the package directions, drain, and set aside to cool.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            In a large bowl, combine the edamame, cabbages, carrots, and scallions. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, ginger, and sambal, if using. Pour the dressing over the slaw, mix well, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Serve garnished with sesame seeds and cilantro.

steps.step: Cook the edamame according to the package directions, drain, and set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, combine the edamame, cabbages, carrots, and scallions. In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, ginger, and sambal, if using.
Pour the dressing over the slaw, mix well, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Serve garnished with sesame seeds and cilantro.
